definition: to come to nothing (idiom)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions
picture/image/film/movie/photograph/reflection/shadow/trace

sentences.english: But those hopes were dashed after North Korea was caught hiding its nuclear program.
sentences.chinese: 但在朝鲜被发现隐藏核计划后，那些希望就化为泡影。

sentences.english: Its modernizing aims were dashed in the face of reality.
sentences.chinese: 大跃进的现代化目标在现实面前化为泡影。

sentences.english: We saw their hope turn into a snare, and their rejoicing into weeping.
sentences.chinese: 我们看到他们的希望化为泡影，他们的欢乐变成哀泣。

sentences.english: At that moment, all my vainglory and proud were gone.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻，我所有的自负和骄傲瞬间化为泡影。

definition: to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to go up in smoke/to vanish
wasted effort
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
to come to nothing (idiom)
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
hopes are dashed
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
to fail to achieve something/to be fruitless
to fail/to fall through/to come to nothing
to omit/to neglect
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to collapse/to fall apart
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
without hope/hopeless/without prospects
